content.description: "The Italian Nation is an organism endowed with a purpose and a life transcending those of the individuals composing it.
content.question: "Labor unions legally recognized and subject to State control alone have the right to represent the whole category for which they are constituted. "The collective labor contract conciliates the opposing interests of employers of workers, subordinating them to the higher interests of production." Mussolini's Charter of Labor, 1927 Which of the following is best supported by the excerpts above?

choices.label: Wages and working conditions were ultimately to be determined by collective bargaining between labor and management.
Italian business firms and factories belonged to the state.
Any group could organize a union and negotiate binding contracts with management.
The state's highest priorities were the individual liberty and economic freedom of its citizens.
Any agreement was subject to the state's interpretation of the national interest.

content.answer: Any agreement was subject to the state's interpretation of the national interest.
